javax.jaxtx.compensation
Interface CompensationTransactionManager

public interface CompensationTransactionManager

This is the interface that container uses to demarcate transactions. The CompensationTransactionManager does not represent a specific transaction, but rather is responsible for providing access to an implicit per-thread transaction context.

Version:
1.0 $Id: CompensationTransactionManager.java,v 1.1 2004/06/22 10:07:59 nmcl Exp $

Method Summary
 void begin()
          Start a new compensation transaction.
 void cancel()
          If the CT must undo its work then the cancel method is used.
 void complete()
          The user of a CT may inform all currently enlisted participants that the work they are expected to do in the scope of the CT has been received.
 void confirm()
          The CT is normally terminated by the confirm method.
 CompensationTransaction currentTransaction()
          The currentTransaction method returns a reference for the current transaction, or null if there is none.
 int getTimeout()
          Returns the timeout value that will be associated with any newly created compensation transactions on behalf of this thread.
 void resume(CompensationTransaction tx)
          The resume method can be used to (re-)associate a thread with a transaction(s).
 void setTimeout(int timeout)
          Sets the timeout value that will be associated with any newly created compensation transactions on behalf of this thread.
 CompensationTransaction suspend()
          A thread of control may require periods of non-transactionality so that it may perform work that is not associated with a specific transaction.
 

Method Detail

begin

public void begin()
           throws NotSupportedException,
                  SystemException
Start a new compensation transaction. Upon success, this operation associates the newly created transaction with the current thread. A timeout may be associated with the transaction if a previous call to setTimeout has been made.

Throws:
NotSupportedException - thrown if nesting of compensation transactions is not supported.
SystemException - thrown if some other error occurs.

confirm

public void confirm()
             throws CompensationTransactionCancelledException,
                    UnknownCompensationTransactionException,
                    SystemException
The CT is normally terminated by the confirm method. This signals to all registered participants that the CT has ended and no compensation is required.

Throws:
CompensationTransactionCancelledException - thrown if the transaction cancelled. This will happen if the timeout elapses prior to a call to confirm.
UnknownCompensationTransactionException - thrown if the system does not recognize the transaction. This may occur if the transaction has previously completed.
SystemException - thrown if some other error occurs.

cancel

public void cancel()
            throws UnknownCompensationTransactionException,
                   SystemException
If the CT must undo its work then the cancel method is used. Any participants that can compensate are forced to do so.

Throws:
UnknownCompensationTransactionException - thrown if the system does not recognize the transaction. This may occur if the transaction has previously completed.
SystemException - thrown if some other error occurs.

complete

public void complete()
              throws UnknownCompensationTransactionException,
                     SystemException
The user of a CT may inform all currently enlisted participants that the work they are expected to do in the scope of the CT has been received.

Throws:
UnknownCompensationTransactionException - thrown if the system does not recognize the transaction. This may occur if the transaction has previously completed.
SystemException - thrown if some other error occurs.

getTimeout

public int getTimeout()
               throws SystemException
Returns the timeout value that will be associated with any newly created compensation transactions on behalf of this thread. This may not be the value associated with any currently running transactions. A value of 0 is an implementation specific timeout.

Returns:
the timeout value associated with this thread.
Throws:
SystemException - thrown if some other error occurs.

setTimeout

public void setTimeout(int timeout)
                throws SystemException
Sets the timeout value that will be associated with any newly created compensation transactions on behalf of this thread. This value will be used if no other value is specified during a subsequent call to begin. A value of 0 is an implementation specific timeout.

Returns:
the timeout value associated with this thread.
Throws:
SystemException - thrown if some other error occurs.

resume

public void resume(CompensationTransaction tx)
            throws UnknownCompensationTransactionException,
                   SystemException
The resume method can be used to (re-)associate a thread with a transaction(s). Prior to association, the thread is disassociated with any transaction(s) with which it may be currently associated.

Throws:
UnknownCompensationTransactionException - thrown if the transaction is invalid in the scope of the invoking thread.
SystemException - thrown if some other error occurs.

suspend

public CompensationTransaction suspend()
                                throws SystemException
A thread of control may require periods of non-transactionality so that it may perform work that is not associated with a specific transaction. In order to do this it is necessary to disassociate the thread from any transactions. The suspend method accomplishes this, returning a reference to the transaction. The thread is then no longer associated with any transaction.

Returns:
the compensation transaction reference, or null if the thread was not associated with a transaction.
Throws:
SystemException - thrown if some other error occurs.

currentTransaction

public CompensationTransaction currentTransaction()
                                           throws SystemException
The currentTransaction method returns a reference for the current transaction, or null if there is none. Unlike suspend, this method does not disassociate the current thread from the transaction(s). This can be used to enable multiple threads to execute within the scope of the same transaction.

Returns:
the compensation transaction reference, or null if the thread was not associated with a transaction.
Throws:
SystemException - thrown if some other error occurs.
